title: Talking Points: Scratch-and-sniff helmet stickers
text:
— Joe Ovies (@joeovies) October 25, 2015 North Carolina: Sloppy, but win over Virginia keeps Heels in Coastal Division race. pic.twitter.com/bv8RGT5pgu — Joe Ovies (@joeovies) October 25, 2015 Duke: Wins first ever 4 overtime game in the ACC, might be Coastal favorite. pic.twitter.com/VYZ9Gb3vq6 — Joe Ovies (@joeovies) October 25, 2015 Virginia Tech: 3-5 in the ACC, questions about Frank Beamer's future. It's gonna be OK. pic.twitter.com/0oPFmz3Qb2 — Joe Ovies (@joeovies) October 25, 2015 Clemson: Handed Miami their worst loss ever and leaves pundits no choice but to take them seriously. pic.twitter.com/L8i0bh3jxq — Joe Ovies (@joeovies) October 25, 2015 Miami: Al Golden's job status. pic.twitter.com/nMlNq6bGK9 — Joe Ovies (@joeovies) October 25, 2015 Georgia Tech: Incredible game-ending blocked field goal win over Florida State. pic.twitter.com/p2VQhXGxpC — Joe Ovies (@joeovies) October 25, 2015 Pitt: I'm sure everyone expected them to be 6-1 after the midway point of the season. pic.twitter.com/0LJjaVJyVW — Joe Ovies (@joeovies) October 25, 2015 Louisville: Bobby Petrino doing the best he can as the Cardinals rebuild. pic.twitter.com/GJnMSHyWh2 — Joe Ovies (@joeovies) October 25, 2015 
A quick run down, so it sticks. 
NC State earned its first ACC win by beating Wake Forest (for the first time since 2001, no less) 35-17: 'Grape' stuff! 
North Carolina's 26-13 victory against Virginia was the Tar Heels' sixth-straight win: De-vine! 
Duke's FOUR overtime 45-43 win against Virginia Tech in the ACC's longest game ever: Plum good! 
"Hokies, can someone explain Frank Beamer's status?": Smile power. (Dopey, grimacing smile) 
Clemson hands The U its worse loss ever and stays undefeated -- the ACC's best looks even better: Hot stuff! 
Miami's Al Golden's job status? Stinks, much like his team's performance this week: Scent-sational (says the steaming skunk) 
The Yellow Jackets' block-six gave Florida State its first ACC loss in 1113 days. That's sure to leave a sting on the Seminoles but for Georgia Tech: Bee-utiful! 
Pitt leads the Coastal Division at 4-0 but the 6-1 start isn't too surprising: Ex-squeeze me?! 
Louisville held on to beat Boston College 17-14. Bobby Petrino's rebuild?: Go for it! (motorcycle to for a smoother ride, coach?) 
Perhaps next week we'll do football analysis with Lisa Frank rainbows and unicorns. Credits
